trans-unit.source: Indicates that there was an error downloading either the ClickOnce manifests or the deployment's files to the client computer.

A <xref:System.Deployment.Application.DeploymentDownloadException> can indicate that a number of problems occurred when the user tried to download a [!INCLUDE[ndptecclick](~/includes/ndptecclick-md.md)] application update:
The client's computer's network connection is down.
The Web server, FTP server, or file share hosting the update is unavailable.
One or more of the files in the [!INCLUDE[ndptecclick](~/includes/ndptecclick-md.md)] deployment was not found.
To obtain detailed error information about an exception, consult the [!INCLUDE[ndptecclick](~/includes/ndptecclick-md.md)] error log.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Deployment.Application.DeploymentDownloadException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Deployment.Application.DeploymentDownloadException"></xref> class with a message that describes the exception.
The message that describes the exception.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Deployment.Application.DeploymentDownloadException"></xref> class.
The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Deployment.Application.DeploymentDownloadException"></xref> class.
The message that describes the exception.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.
If the innerException parameter is not `null`, the current exception is raised in a `catch` block that handles the inner exception.
